intro: Scleria mayottensis, commonly known as the Mayotte speargrass, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown in color. Scleria mayottensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
